import React, { useState } from 'react' import { Link } from 'react-router-dom' const inputTag = { width: '100%', padding: '10px 20px', borderRadius: '5px', border: '1px solid grey' } function Person() { const [info, setInfo] = useState({ firstName: '', lastName: '', email: '', address: '', city_town: '', staProReg: '', country: '', zip: '' }) const handleChange = (event) => { const {name, value} = event.target setInfo(prevState => { return{...prevState, [name]: value} }) } const handleSubmit = (event) => { const store = { 'Fname': info.firstName, 'Lname': info.firstName, 'email': info.email, 'st_address': info.address, 'city': info.city_town, 'province': info.staProReg, 'country': info.country, 'zip': info.zip }; event.preventDefault(); fetch('http://localhost:3090/api/person_info/', { method: 'POST', headers: { 'Content-Type': 'application/json', }, body: JSON.stringify(store), }) .then(response => response.json()) .then(data => { alert('Success') console.log(data); }) .catch((error) => { alert("Error:") console.log(error); }) } return ( <>

) } //make sure that the radio button replaces the input of the 'Name On Package' when checked and clears when unchecked //make 'onsubmit' functions //store info when submitted in database //record all inputted data and store them accordingly within each database section //call the databases required to do so //use state variables to store data export default Person
